item.title: BitJam Episode #01 - The Beginning
item.description: This episode contains a mix of the tunes found on BitJam Vol. 1.: Solaris, not all tunes are in the podcast due to the sheer size of the musicdisk. Mixed by Vincenzo, jingle by KEiTO, logo by Haz

item.title: BitJam Episode #02 - Melodic
item.description: We selected cute melodic tunes for your aural pleasure and enjoyment. Mixed by Vincenzo, jingle by KEiTO, logo by KF

item.title: BitJam Episode #03 - In Space
item.description: In space, only Darth Vader can you hear boogie, young Padavan! Mixed by Vincenzo, jingle by Virgill, logo by KF

item.title: BitJam Episode #04 - Elektronik, supersonik
item.description: Elektronik. Supersonik. Fasten your beltseats and listen to the upbeat drums! Mixed by Vincenzo, jingle by Virgill, logo by RayNoa

item.title: BitJam Episode #05 - Instant computermusic
item.description: Bitjam Podcast #5. Remixing the ears with currywurst and soda. Mixed by Vincenzo, jingle by Virgill, logo by KF and Can

item.title: BitJam Episode #06 - C64 only selection
item.description: Bitjam Podcast #6. Presented in surround mono, where available! Mixed by Vincenzo, intro sounds by Virgill, logo by Brainbox

item.title: BitJam Episode #07 - Tribute
item.description: This episode is a tribute to all demosceners who have passed away and only contains music from people who left us. When you listen to these songs, spare a thought for them, their families and friends. Rest in peace brethren. Mixed by Vincenzo, jingle by Vicky, logo by RayNoa

item.title: BitJam Episode #08 - Classic gametunes
item.description: Remember the old days of gaming; who had the fastest triggerfinger? Who had the best skills to memorize enemy formations and locations? Who could beat the bosses? It was all very hard when you also had a kickass tune to tap your feet to. Now you can enjoy the tunes without any enemy interference in Bitjam Episode #8 - The Bitempire Strikes Back... Mixed by Vincenzo, jingle by KEiTO, logo by Brainbox

item.title: BitJam Episode #09 - Italocast
item.description: In the 80's everything was better: Shoulderpads, excessive use of neon, plastic overdose, hairspray AND italo disco! Tune in to this weeks podcast to tickle your 80's memory glands, and enjoy our selection of italo-sounding tracks. Plutonium by Myx was especially composed for our 9th podcast episode. Thank you Myx!

item.title: BitJam Episode #10 - Happy Halloween!
item.description: It's alive! Pumpkin man welcomes you to this spooky halloween special of BitJam podcast. Lock yourself inside, don't answer the door or the phone, and enjoy it with a bloody mary. Trick or treat? Mixed by Vincenzo, logo by KF

item.title: BitJam Episode #10.5 - Antique Toy special
item.description:
The deadline for Antique Toy has been extended till November 15th. So everybody who hasn't finished their works for the compo still have a chance. Here are the rules. All questions and suggestions are accepted by mail: -email- This podcast features tunes from antique antique toy compos.
Mixed by Vincenzo and C-Jeff, jingle by pOWL, logo by Zoom, Antique Toy logo by Asphyx and girl (Picture: Finality) by Deadie.

item.title: BitJam Episode #11 - Amiga classics
item.description:
This time the podcast contains classic Amiga demotunes turntable-mixed by Virgill. I'm saying it's going to be a very big hit!
Mixed by Virgill, exclusive Bitjam jingle by CONS, logo by KF

item.title: BitJam Episode #12 - Function 2007 special
item.description:
This episode contains interviews with the Function2007 visitors: Kelsey, Jailbird, Dipswitch and Nuke. Sadly, the interviews with Delilah, Iq and Irene were bugged (thanks to the recorder), so we couldn't use them... Sorry guys...
Mixed by Vincenzo, logo by Zoom, special guest star: Pohar, as reporter

item.title: BitJam Episode #13 - Rebels remixed
item.description: Rebels - the band of badboys give you an almanach: memories of a decade, our finest ingredients. After 20 years of rebelling, making demoscene productions, being one of the oldest scenegroups, we are still here. We give you a little piece of our history in chronological order. Rebels - We Make All Days Partydays!

item.title: BitJam Episode #14 - Mo' Playaz
item.description:
Founded in 1999, Most Valuable Playaz (also knows as MVP or simply Mo'Playaz) was the cream of the crop when it came to drum'n'bass. Releasing mostly tracked modules, it has been a home for many nowadays big d'n'b names such as Muffler, Psidream, Krii aka Resound and Mad-E. When MVP went inactive in 2002, the scene lost one of the last quality tracking groups. Bitjam brings you a best-of Mo'Playaz special, exclusively mixed by labelhead tEiS and featuring the biggest MVP hits as well as unreleased material. Tune in, junglist!
Mixed by tEiS, logo #14 by KF, text by Dipswitch

item.title: BitJam Episode #15 - The Scene.hu "JFF" competition chartshow
item.description:
Just For Fun, this was the motto of the long awaited online music competition, organized by www.scene.hu with Slyspy's leadership. The compo was a big success: 30 musicians entered. This is a nice summary, because the hungarian demoscene is small (around ~250ppl nowadays). This podcast will guide you trough the entries in "Viva chartshow style", starting from the last placed song to the first. Have fun!
Mixed by Vincenzo, logo #15 by Zoom

item.title: BitJam Episode #16 - Best of 4k intro soundtracks
item.description:
We got our microscope and went looking for big hits in very small packages. This time the podcast contains 100% pure softsynth action in the form of big, big tunes from tiny, tiny 4k intros. Part radiomix, part beatmix - enjoy this special guest BitJam Podcast mixing appearance by Gloom. Shoutouts to the peeps in the nordic conspiracy!
Mixed by Gloom, Jingles by Virgill, logo #16 by H2O

item.title: BitJam Episode #17 - It ain't much if it ain't Dutch
item.description: Attention! The Dutch are coming! Holland has given us a lot of good composers. We have picked the best tracks among wooden shoes, tulips and windmills for your enjoyment. And many thanks to Reyn for his exclusive music! Mixed by Vincenzo, jingle by pOWL and Virgill, logo #17 by Alien^PDX

item.title: Bitjam Episode #18 - Revenge of Brainstorm
item.description: Switzerland isn't just the known for cheese-holes, gold-bullions, watches and chocolate, but also for being the origin country of the demoscene group Brainstorm. Now being a completely international team, Brainstorm doesn't always take itself too seriously and relentlessly keeps injecting some humour into the scene. In this podcast Bitjam is taking a journey through parts of the group's archives, ranging from ZINE to Chillosophy, Cui-Zine, Rhino Discharge, Fairytale and more. This podcast also features an exclusive brand new track by Scott.

item.title: Bitjam Episode #19 - Drum and bass part 2
item.description: Episode #19 - Drum and bass part 2 Once again we present some tracked drum'n'bass music from the 1990s - and this time it's about two trackinggroups: Theralite from Hungary and Rebound from Finland. Both hosted some big artists, in terms of demoscene credit as well as later "reallife" d'n'b status. So here we go with some big tunes - speed up and headbang with us again in the second Drum and Bass podcast episode! Mixing and jingle by Vincenzo, compiled by Dipswitch, logo #19 by KF

item.title: Bitjam Episode #20 - 20 years of scenemusic
item.description:
Episode #20 - 20 years of scenemusic This episode is a homage to the last 20 years of demoscene music - one tune from each year from 1987 until 2007. Please note that the year of the demo was used rather than the year the tune was made, for example Physical Presence was made in 1993 but FLT^VD - Love was released in 1994. Also as this is episode #20 we would like to thank all who have supported us with their own podcasts and given us ideas and feedback. Thanks to Alecs^BRS for his help!
Mixed by Vincenzo, jingle by Virgill, compiled by Serpent, logo #20 by H2O

item.title: Bitjam Episode #21 - Navis at [d]vision
item.description:
Episode #21 - VIENNA DEMOSCENE MEETING0001 - Navis^ASD - about the Pc demoscene - brought to you by [d]vision As warming up for the Demoscene Event Vienna taking place in quartier 21 area for digital culture in Museusmquartier Vienna from 4th - 20th of July 2008, [d]vision is organising monthly demoscene-meetings in werkzeugH. Austrian demosceners, international demoscene guests and everyone interested and fascinated in demos is invited to participate. The vienna demoscene meeting is a relaxed get together with drinks, talks and of course demo-shows. Each meeting will see a different theme of demos, as an Atari demo-show, PC demos or C64 demos. International guests and enthusiast demosceners curate and host the shows. So pop by, have a drink and enjoy demos on the bigscreen.
Mixed by Vincenzo, jingle by aMUSIC, logo #21 by Zoom

item.title: Bitjam Episode #22 - Original vs. Remix
item.description:
Episode #22 - Original vs. Remix This time we bring you a pack of siblings - sister remix and big brother original. Which one do you prefer, did the remix bring something good or is the original still the best? You decide..!
Mixing and jingle by Vincenzo, logo #22 by KF

item.title: BitJam Episode #23 - BitWerk Non-Stop
item.description:
Episode #23 - BitWerk Non-Stop It starts with E and ends with lectro. 'Nuff said!
Mixing by Vincenzo, Jingle by Virgill, logo #23 by KF

item.title: BitJam Episode #24 - Sexiest Female Singers
item.description:
Episode #24 - Sexiest female singers It's time for some sweet female vocal lovin' as we unleash an episode filled with songs which feature ... Female singers.
Mixing by Vincenzo, Jingle by Virgill, logo #24 by KF

item.description:
OMG Tracne si teh beast!!!!!1one Tish teim wii meaksead haeghly up!beat tuens 4 yer plaeazur. Ay caen haz phun widdieth! Thaenks four JaeyCeeOuch and B00biec 4 teh haepl!1

item.description:
Episode #26 - This episode of BitJam is filled with work from active and also formerly active scene-musicians that hail from Berlin/Germany.

item.title: Bitjam Episode #27 - [d]vision part 2
item.description:
Episode #27 - [d]vision part 2 Gargaj visited Vienna on the 14th of December and gave an insight view of the life of a Democoder in Conspiracy and Ãœmlaut Design, his rockstardays after the first success, Eastern European travelguides and more, frequently interrupted by lots and lots of demos plus commercial breaks for the Function Demoparty in Hungary.
Mixing by Vincenzo, logo #27 by H2O

item.title: Bitjam Episode #28 - Happy 2nd BitDay, BitFellas
item.description:
Episode #28 - Happy 2nd BitDay, Bitfellas! An episode to celebrate the second anniversary of BitFellas. Kick back, relax, and enjoy a bunch of previously unreleased songs!
Mixing by Vincenzo, jingles by tEiS and Buzzer, logo #27 by KF

item.title: Bitjam Episode #29 - C64 music part 2
item.description:
Episode #29 - C64 part 2 - Back to the roots Here we go again with a fine C64 music collection. Oldschool music lovers! Prepare your ears, turn up the volume, and forget about your neighbours! Houston, counting down: 5...4...3...1... Offblast!
Mixing by Vincenzo, jingle by pOWL, logo #27 by Skan

item.title: Bitjam Episode #30 - Breakpoint 2008 specials
item.description:
Episode #30 and #30 - Breakpoint 2008 specials This weekend we will celebrate the 30th episode of both Bitjam and Hardread Podcast, so we will play the two brand new episodes right after each other this Sunday evening. So, prepare the double of your regular dose of beer and enjoy the finest releases of Breakpoint 2008!
Mixing by Vincenzo, jingle by Chromag, logo #30 by H2O

item.title: Bitjam Episode #31 - Atari Falcon classics
item.description:
Episode #31 - Atari Falcon classics Back in 1992 the new Atari Falcon arrived. Its specifications like a Motorola 68030 CPU, True Color graphics, a DSP and high quality sound was a great new playground for demomakers. While the Atari ST scene was largely dying, a lot of great demos, full of high skilled craftwork and innovative ideas, where created on the Falcon around the middle of the 90s. This episode presents a selection of the music that came along with those colorful demowonders. Have a nice trip back into these lovely times.
Mixing, compiling and jingles by 505, logo by H2O

item.title: Bitjam Episode #32 - Merregnon special
item.description:
Bitfellas proudly presents: Merregnon!
Merregnon is a soundtrack CD project for which renowned composers from the game industry contribute brand-new titles. By writing orchestral music the artists tell a story taking place in a newly created fantasy-universe. Stars like Chris Huelsbeck (Star Wars: Rogue Squadron 2), Yuzo Koshiro (Shenmue) and Fabian Del Priore (Cultures 2) already speak for themselves. They, and a number of many more music veterans, have signed on to work on this album trilogy, whose atmosphere will additionally be nourished with impressions and pictures from the richly decorated booklets. (text taken from www.merregnon.com)
Mixing by Vincenzo, logo #33 by Merregnon studios feat. Alien^PDX Special thanks to Bobic, who made this episode possible. Thank you!

item.title: Bitjam Episode #33 - Hardread - We are back in town!
item.description:
Episode #33 - Hardread - We are back in town! This is your backstage ticket. You can look into the magician's hat. These are the best songs from Pohar's Favourites list at Bitfellas.org. And don't forget to visit our new podcast page: http://hdpodcast.blogspot.com!
Mixing by Vincenzo, logo #33 by KF, compiled by Pohar

item.title: Bitjam Episode #34 - Preselected tunes
item.description:
Episode #34 - Preselected tunes In this episode we selected prejuried tunes from various parties. Sometimes they are better than the played ones. Aren't they...?
Mixing by Vincenzo, jingle by tEiS, logo #34 by KF

item.title: Bitjam Episode #35 - Best cooperation tunes
item.description:
Episode #35 - Best cooperation tunes From the very early days, demoscene composers have always collaborated, and some of the scene's most classic pieces have come from such cooperations. Welcome to BitJam Podcast #35, where we present to you the creme de la creme of these pieces. Listen to this the only appropriate way - in stereo
Mixing by Vincenzo, jingle by tEiS, logo #34 by H2O

item.title: Bitjam Episode #36 - Bitjam Anthologies feat. Virgill
item.description:
Episode #36 - Bitjam Anthologies feat. Virgill - 20 years of demoscene music To honour the scene gladiators, that entertained us for decades, the BitJam dynasty proclaims the first part of the greatest games you can attend to with your senses: BitJam Anthologies featuring Virgill - 20 Years of Scenemusic.
Mixing, compiling and jingle by Cons, logo by H2O

item.title: Bitjam Episode #37 - Atari ST tunes
item.description:
Episode #37 - Atari ST tunes During the period of 1989-1992, which one could call the peak of the classic Atari ST demoscene, a huge amount of ST-megademos were released. The were full of wobbling logos, flexible and entertaining scollers, dot effects, sprites, bobs, flat shaded 3d... and all that along with YM-chipmusic. The dominating musician back than was doubtlessly Mad Max beeing responsible for about 90% of the Atari demomusics in some way. Nevertheless quite an amount of other chipmusicians participated in the demproductions as well. Some of the heartpieces of all those musicians are compiled in this Podcast. For an Atari ST scener its likely a mix of very well known tunes and speaking personally, some of the tunes wake some really good old feelings in me still today. For other demosceners it might be a bit of a best-of-compile from those years - when three channels were an orchestra, 16 colors were enough for our oil-paintings and so many limits still had to be broken.
Selection and mixing by 505, logo #37 by H2O and Brainbox

item.title: Bitjam Episode #38 - Fighting tunes
item.description:
Episode #38 - Fighting tunes Martial Arts has been a fascination for many composers working within the demoscene, as well as the subject of many classic game soundtracks. It seemed only fitting then, that we should dedicate an episode of the podcast to these tunes - some with an oriental feel, some that just kicks your ass. Enjoy!
Mixing by Vincenzo, logo #38 by KF

item.title: BitJam Episode #39 - Boyc at [d]vision
item.description:
Demoscene meeting 0011 with [d]vision with guest speaker BoyC gives you a interesting look into the creation of 64K Intros - How to make stunning effects with minimalistic code.
Mixing by Vincenzo, jingle by ne7, logo #39 by H2O

item.title: BitJam Episode #40 - ExoticA
item.description:
Episode #40 - ExoticA ExoticA brings you a podcast with a selection of tracks from the ExoticA website. Including some popular game tunes as well as some more exotic musical delights.
Compiled by BuZz and XtC. Mixing by Vincenzo and XtC, jingles by Barry Leitch, ne7 and Buzzer, logo #40 by KF

item.title: BitJam Episode #41 - Barry's scene favourites
item.description:
Episode #41 - Barry's scene favourites
Compiled by Barry Leitch, mixing by Vincenzo, logo #41 by KF
Few people acknowledge how much the scene influenced the games of the era, and thus in turn the games influenced the scene. I've selected several pieces that over the years influenced me, pieces that I still have in my playlist and much to my wife and kids dissapointment play in the car. With such a wealth of material to pick from, a bank so much richer than the mainstream, please consider omissions merely due to my lack of space.

item.title: BitJam Episode #42 - Synth classic'
item.description:
This is a "downloadable only" podcast episode. No radio, no airing on sunday, but it's released finally! This time we collected some really good-flowing synth tunes for your enjoyment. BitJam Podcast is back online!
Mixing by Vincenzo, logo #40 by KF Big big thanks to Sahkolihaa for his help.

item.title: BitJam Episode #43 - C64 multispeed tunes
item.description:
Episode #43 - SIDs You Thought They Were Not - Multispeed tunes This is a "downloadable only" podcast episode. No radio, no airing on sunday... Multispeed tunes have been a new dimension in C64 history. They sound very different to regular C64 music, sometimes you can't even recognize them as SIDs at all. We collected and mixed some high quality multispeed sids for this episode, enjoy listening and have fun!
Mixing and jingle by Vincenzo, logo #43 by Sander

item.title: BitJam Episode #44 - Roland LAPC-I tunes
item.description:
Episode #44 - Roland LAPC-I tunes The LAPC-I is an 8-bit ISA sound card for the IBM-PC, released by Roland in 1988. Containing the same technology of the Roland D-50, it allowed composers to create their own sounds at a much lower price. Being targetted towards home users, it was also supported in many MS-DOS games in the late 80s and early 90s. Unfortunately, most gamers couldn't afford one, so they missed out on superb music and were stuck with the cheaper Sound Blaster sound cards. This podcast has been put together to bring back the game music you once missed.
Mixing by Vincenzo, jingle by Buzzer, logo #44 by KF, compiled by Sahkolihaa

item.title: BitJam Episode #45 - TRSi allstars
item.description:
TRSi, the alliance of Tristar and Red Sector Inc. is kicking since summer 1990 and has delivered since numerous productions on Amiga, C-64, numerous consoles and the PC. BitJam Podcast #45 contains a small selection fine musical pieces of that period mixed together by mastermind tEiS.
Mixing by tEiS, logo #45 by H2O

item.title: BitJam Episode #46 - Selected Spectrum works
item.description:
Welcome! This is the selection of highlights from the reach variety of spectrum music. Sure, there are thousands of them and next time you will get any more. I promise. - C-jeff
Mixing by Vincenzo, logo #46 by Raynoa, compiled by C-jeff

item.title: BitJam Episode #47 - BitJam anthologies feat. Barry Leitch
item.description:
22 years in the game industry, Hundreds of games.. Boatloads of toys.. One of the most prolific composers of the era. You have most likely heard his work. It's hard to avoid it. Even today a walk thru Wal-Mart finds at least a dozen items with audio by Barry. He's written more music on more formats that anyone else on the planet..
Mixing by Vincenzo, logo #47 by KF, compiled by Barry Leitch. Big big thank you goes to Sahkolihaa for his help!

item.title: BitJam Episode #48 - Revenge of the DOS Prompt
item.description:
Episode #48 - Revenge of the DOS Prompt Break out your 386s and your GUS cards! The BitJam podcast is booting up the finest tunes to ever grace your PeeCee - and no Windows required! Remember how much fun it was to make sure you left enough CPU to mix all 16 channels in software? Double check that DMA channel and let the BitJam podcast bring you back in time...
Mixing by Vincenzo, jingle by Buzzer, logo #48 by KF, big thank you goes to ALecs and Bobic for their ideas and help!

item.title: BitJam Episode #49 - HighScore Music
item.description:
Episode #49 - HighScore Music BitJam are happy to bring you some of the best and most memorable Highscore tunes from the time when reaching that No.1 slot and beating your friend was so important! Join us on a journey to reach these heights as we travel from the games 'Alien' to 'X-Out' covering many classics and platforms along the way.
Mixing by Vincenzo, jingle by Virgill, logo #49 by KF Big thank you to Sahkolihaa, Bobic, KEiTO and The Godfather for their ideas and help!

item.title: BitJam Episode #49b - Christmas 2008 Special
item.description:
Episode #49b - Christmas 2008 Special episode In true Christmas spirit BitJam have a gift for you that you can open straight away! Enjoy our selection of exclusive tracks and celebrate by turning your stereo up to hear this wide selection of fun unreleased material. We send out greetings and thanks to all competitors in this episode. Guys, you rock! Merry Xmas!
Mixing by Vincenzo, logo #49b by H2O, episode idea by KEiTO

item.title: BitJam Episode #50 - Just the best
item.description:
Episode #50 - Just the best We celebrate our 50th episode with the best tracks from BitJam favourite lists.
Mixing by Vincenzo, jingle by Virgill, logo #50 by H2O and Brainbox

item.title: BitJam Episode #51 - Sun chilling area
item.description:
Episode #51 - Sun chilling area The playlist reflects a day on the beach. In the morning everybody is full of power, having fun and action around and in the water, but as the day moves on everybody slows down and is enjoying the mild afternoon sun with a smile and thinking about the good day they had.
Mixing, compiling and jingle by air2k, logo #51 by H2O

item.title: BitJam Episode #52 - Hits for Kids - Play it again, daddy!
item.description:
Episode #52 - Hits for Kids Is your kid crying all the time? Do you need all your energy for playing? BitJam helps you to diaper your children! See you soon at the "Father's table" at Breakpoint2009!
Mixing and jingle by Mommy Vincenzo, logo #52 by Big Daddy H2O, idea and compiling by Babysitter Bobic

item.title: BitJam Episode #53 - AY Riders
item.description:
Episode #53 - AY Riders AY is the SID of Spectrum. It might be outdated, but it is still alive in the good old East-European block. Just listen to these wizards who run two or even three computers in perfect synch to make this magical music. AY riders is on the stage tonight.
Mixing by Vincenzo, jingle by Yerzmyey, logo #53 by KF, compiling by Yerzmyey and Pohar

item.title: BitJam Episode #54 - Doskpop
item.description:
Episode #54 - Doskpop As a special treat for those of us that remember that crazy musical style pioneered by Lizardking and continued by a host of other sceners; kick back and listen to a selection of the finest doskpop ziks the scene has to offer, just like its the 90's all over again!
Mixing by Vincenzo, logo #54 by Speedy

item.title: BitJam Episode #55 - Comic and Cartoon
item.description:
Episode #55 - Comic and Cartoon If you ever wondered how it would feel if the toys would force you under THEIR bed, tune into Bitjam's brand new happydose of a hyperactive chimpanzee going wild with a pressure-sensitive music box made partly out of Goofy's chest hair. Enjoy this merry medley of twiddly tripletry, buffoonous beats and curious crescendos, but remember! Maybe there's a duck watching you. Right now. From the shadows. Of the kitchen sink. In southern France. Seriously.
Mixing by Vincenzo, logo #55 by KF, Haz and Helge

item.title: BitJam Episode #56 - Droppin' it to our Dawgs
item.description:
Episode #56 - Droppin' it to our Dawgs Yo homiez, this is Deejay Vizzle on the wheels of lethal steel, stick ya earz this Sunday the phattest choons of tha block fo' REAL! We out, PEACE!
Mixing by Dj Vizzle, jingle by Mc SiEt, logo #56 by C-Killa and K-to-tha-F

item.title: BitJam Episode #57 - Spectrum demotunes
item.description:
Episode #57 - Spectrum demotunes The revenge of the spectrum sawtooth. Turning technical deficits into musical brilliance. Listen to the finest you can get from square waveforms and vast varieties of blip blops.
Mixing by Vincenzo, logo #57 by Grass, compiled by C-jeff

item.title: BitJam Episode #58 - Happy 3rd birthday BitFellas!
item.description:
Episode #58 - We are 3! BitFellas is another year older, as we make a special secret scene related wish (after blowing out the 3rd candle on the birthday cake) we'd like to welcome you all firstly by pointing you to a very special podcast put together by Vincenzo and Bobic to celebrate us becoming toddlers! Anyway onto the show; Bobic's made a cool selection on the best of what the German scene has to offer to celebrate the new German language area of BitFellas called .deMOSZENE! Enjoy!
Mixing by Vincenzo, jingle by Virgill, logo #58 by H2O, compiled by Bobic

item.title: BitJam Episode #59 - Brainstorm Reloaded
item.description:
Episode #59 - Brainstorm Reloaded In 2009, Brainstorm is celebrating it's 20th anniversary, so we're hereby paying the group its tribute. We chose not to do so with old tracks, but with mostly new ones from its Tracked in Time musicdisk. Add to that a bit of tracks from 1994 and 2009 and you'll be just fine. And you can rest assured that the group shows no signs of slowing down in 2009 and beyond.
Mixing by Vincenzo, jingle by Buzzer, logo #59 by gr4ss

item.title: BitJam Episode #60 - BitJam Remix 001 Compo Entries
item.description:
Episode #60 - BitJam RMX 001 Compo Entries Some time ago we at Bitfellas decided to try and organize an interesting compo - we picked three tracks for other musicians to remix and compete in who can make up the best reinterpretations of these songs. The competition itself, as you know, ended on a dismal note, but we decided not to let the tracks end up unused, so here's a brand new podcast compiled from the (purely subjectively selected) best tracks of the competition!
Mixing and compiling by Vincenzo, jingles by Virgill, logo #60 by KF

item.title: BitJam Episode #61 - Game Over!
item.description: Episode #61 - Game Over --- insert KEiTO's text here --- Mixing by Vincenzo, jingle by Virgill, logo #61 by KF

item.title: BitJam Episode #62 - Happy Chips
item.description:
Episode #62 - Happy chips This week our resident cheer disposal units bring you this sawtoothed ball of joy, one hour of pure happiness and pulse width modulation, making sure we dont filter out any good vibes and everything brings a smile to your face fair and square.
Mixing by Vincenzo, jingle by Virgill, logo #62 by KF, compiled by SaphirJD

item.title: BitJam Episode #63 - We got balls of boing
item.description:
Episode #63 - We got balls of boing Watching the demoscene evolve on the Amiga in the early 90's had a definite feeling of wonderment about it - certainly in no small part due to the amazing music the talents in the field magically made appear from our speakers. 8 bit, 4 channels, and some of these guys could still make these humble sound chips sound like the symphony orchestra. It is with the hope that you experience some of that wonderment tonight, we present to you BitJam Podcast 63. For further exploration into the demoscene, we recommend you to visit our sister site, BitWorld, where you can lose yourself in demoscene magic 24/7. Enjoy!
Mixing by Vincenzo, jingle by Cons, logo #63 by KF, compiled by Zeg

item.title: BitJam Episode #64 - Very special C64 episode
item.description:
Episode #64 - Very special C64 episode On this very special sunday, we present you a very special mix, created from very special songs made by very special people on a very special computer, in remembrance of a very special time giving us very special memories.
Mixing by a very special Vincenzo, jingle by a very special pOWL, logo #64 by a very special Sander

item.title: BitJam Episode #65 - Underwater Luve
item.description:
Episode #65 - Underwater Luve Dive into a bubbling journey into our oceanbed, where our sonars located the finest catches of audio-aquatic beauties for your snorkels. Take a deep breath, dwell through our marine melodies and have a whale of a time!

item.title: BitJam Episode #71 - ST-01 Tunes
item.description: Episode #71 - ST-01 Tunes Let's go back, way back, back into time... Along with the revolutionary Soundtracker released by Karsten Obarski back in 1987 came with it the now legendary ST-01 sample disk. Packed with classic sounds these short samples gave the talented musicians of that time the ability to create some of the most instantly recognizable masterpieces in module format. Join us as we celebrate these sounds and musicians with a selection of the very best ST-01 tunes. Compiled and mixed by SoDa7, jingle also by SoDa7, logo #71 by H2O.

item.title: BitJam Episode #72 - Diskmag tunes
item.description:
Episode #72 - Diskmag tunes This podcast was specifically crafted to present you songs you normally don't hear - because everyone just turns off music for diskmags. A collection of songs, created to augment your reading experience when you lean back in your armchair and turn the pages of the screen.
Mixing by Vincenzo, jingle by CONS, logo #72 by H2O

item.title: BitJam Episode #73 - Tribute to Michael Jackson
item.description:

item.title: BitJam Episode #74 - French classics
item.description:
Episode #74 - French classics - Come to MAIN Party! This Sunday is a really special day, as we would like to announce our 74th podcast episode together with MAIN Party and BitFellas Remix Compo #002! First, today podcast episode is a salute to the greatest French composers - their work deserves a dedicated mix! Our other "main" announcement is the upcoming MAIN Party in France. We would like to invite you to come to MAIN Party, which will be held 2nd to 4th october 2009 - La Grande Halle, 13200 Arles, France. And last but not least announcement for today is our brand new remix competition! This compo is also a salute to 3 French composers, namely Moby, Fred and Willbe. Check the Compopage for more details!
Mixing and jingles by tEiS, logo #74 by H2O

item.title: BitJam Episode #75 - Movie and TV themes
item.description:
Episode #75 - Movie and TV themes When you were young and you had just one TV at home, you had to turn off your computer when your family wanted to see their favourite series. Why not mixing the two? Enjoy the best TV series and movie themes on your BitBox!
Mixing by Vincenzo, jingle by CONS, logo #75 by Floyd

item.title: BitJam Episode #76 - Disaster Area
item.description:
Episode #76 - Disaster area When the earth decides to open it's jaws of doom and buildings get destroyed, when a hurricane is chasing people or a storm is causing fear; then you'll know that even catastrophes like natual disasters can't triumph over the power of good music. BitJam Podcast episode #76 features the work of musicians, who turned the power of disaster into mighty sounds.
Mixing by Vincenzo, logo #76 by unc/Ized, compiled by Bobic

item.title: BitJam Episode #77 - Chillout
item.description:
Episode #77 - Chillout Stop. Sit Down. Close your eyes. Relax. Don't use drugs to fly away, let the music take your mind to a trip. Today we will fly away to the slo-mo chillout world. Filled with quality music, mixed with our sixth sense, flavoured with calm beats.
Mixing and jingle by Vincenzo, logo #77 by .reEto, compiled by Sahkolihaa

item.title: BitJam Episode #78 - Oriental and Far East Music
item.description:
Episode #78 - Oriental and Far East Music The special oriental style of music has been an inspiration to demoscene musicians ever since the very beginning, and has resulted in a long line of tracks with an oriental feel, or which borrow heavily from oriental music tradition. Even entire demos have been dedicated to this style, and it has had a profound impact that has created a subgenre all of its own. We leave you today with something quite unique - The BitFellas podcast oriental style. Enjoy.
Mixing by Vincenzo, logo #78 by KF

item.title: BitJam Episode #79 - Amiga Crack intro trax
item.description:
Episode #79 - Amiga Crack intro trax For too many of us, our first contact with what we later learned to be the demoscene, were the colorful little introductions that got tacked on the games we "found" for our first computers. We got used to the names in the logos, came to think of them as our friends, and found ourselves humming our favourite little tunes from the intros. This issue of the BitFellas podcast pays tribute to those pioneering, early steps in the demoscene evolution. So, close your eyes, take yourself back to that magical time, and... pop that imaginary cracked game disk in the floppy drive.
Mixing by Vincenzo, logo #79 by KF, compiled by zeg, big thank you to Menace for his support!

item.title: BitJam Episode #80 - Top os the 80's Pop
item.description:
Episode #80 - Top of the 80' Pop WARNING: Childhood memories overflow!
Mixing by Vincenzo, jingle by .reEto, logo #80 by KF

item.description:

item.title: BitJam Episode #82 - Phlow-Magazine.com Special
item.description:
BitJam Episode #82 - Phlow-Magazine.com Special
Phlow-Magazine.com is a weblog about free mp3 music culture. Our magazine offers you free music to download from netlabels and musicians all over the globe. We pick the finest songs and digg the fattest grooves out of terrabytes of music released under a creative commons licence. Listen to our podcast, have a look into our mp3-archive of free music and read our portraits of amazing netlabels and musicians. * Our podcast: http://feed.phlow-magazine.com/phlow-magazine * Play it loud, bwoy! http://player.phlow-magazine.com * Free Dj mixes and Compilations http://phlow-magazine.com/dj-mixes-and-compilations/
Mixing and jingle by Vincenzo, logo #82 by H2O, episode organizing work by Bobic. We would like to send a big Thank You! to Moritz "mo" Sauer (head of Phlow magazine)!

A full-on DJ mix so to speak, with only "commercially viable" tunes. A "break out" podcast, if you will. How does this idea sound?" It sounds really cool!

item.title: BitJam Episode #88a - BitJam Remix Compo #02 Entries
item.description:
Episode #88a and #88b - BitJam Remix Compo #02 Entries and Main Party 2009 selection It's 2009 and it's been scientifically proven: Everything is better in twos. (Or eights, depending on who you ask.) So let us here at BitFellas present our beloved audience with an extra special treat: MAIN2009 was a raging success, both because of the BitJam Remix Compo #02 and the general quality level of the compo entries, so we made the best decision possible and compiled NOT ONE BUT TWO FIFTEEN INCH MONI... uh... podcasts for you! AND THAT'S NOT ALL! We also put in, for FREE, an unreleased remix by Chromag! (...who we hereby advise to next time hand in his entry ON the week of the party, not AFTER.) So enjoy more than 90 minutes of fresh music and start preparing your travel plans for next year!
Mixing and jingles by Vincenzo, logo #88 by H2O, special thanks to our guest Dino for his voice -used in jingles!

item.title: BitJam Episode #90 - Farbrausch Demo Trax Remixed
item.description:
Episode #90 - Farbrausch Demo Trax Remixed Clean, Polished and Cutting Edge. These words come to mind when you think about certain Farbrausch productions that have pushed the boundaries of code just that little bit farther. This podcast will convince you that the same things can be said for the soundtracks of those demos too! Experience them in a new way and be reminded of the audiovisual extravaganza of those releases; without the music, none of them would have been the experience that they were!
Mixing and jingle by .reEto, logo #90 by H2O

item.title: BitJam Episode #91 - Legends from 1991
item.description: Episode #91 - Legends from 1991 1991 - Many of us were just growing up, having a more or less good time at school and dealing with so many teenie-things. But then again, there was the chance to look into this little plastic box of a monitor on the desk and a bit of relief came up. An own creative and colorful world, nobody could disturb, with so much to discover on one single disk. The feelings back then are hard to describe, take this Podcast to get an idea what the taste of 1991 was about.

item.title: BitJam Episode #92 - Legends from 1992
item.description:
For long time, there have been rumours in print magazines about new machines coming up. Finally, in the autumn of 1992 new machines appeared on the horizon. Amiga 1200 and Atari Falcon 030 were their names. This was reason for so much joy, due to the new and faster 68020/68030 processor, unbelievable 16.7 million displayable colors and chrystal clear sound capabilities of 50khz. Virgin lands of state of the Art of technology waited to be explored. On the other side, some of us were in deep love with the good old and trusty Amiga 500 or Atari ST. And some of them were even a bit afraid, that the new machine may make everyone forget about their little brothers. Still, having both old and new at the same time induced a big push in creativity. Feel it again with this Podcast!
Mixing by Vincenzo, jingle by Virgill, logo #91 by H2O, compiled by 505

item.title: BitJam Episode #93 - 12 Months of Music
item.description:
Episode #93 - 12 Months of Music One year, 12 months... 12 months of music from the scene. Artists transport their feelings into their songs, sometimes also their feelings of a special season or month. What do they feel in January, what during the golden days of October? This podcast features only tunes which are dedicated to one of the 12 months of a year, starting in January and ending in... exactly, December! By releasing BitJam podcast episode #93 "12 Months of Music" we open a new area, our Demoscene Calendar. Please submit your party info to: http://www.demoparty.net/ we are pulling the data from there.
Mixing and jingle by Vincenzo, logo #93 by KF, compiled by Bobic

item.title: BitJam Episode #98 - Industrial and EBM Tracks
item.description:
Episode #98 - Industrial and EBM Tracks Def.: Industrial Experimental music style, often including electronic music, that draws on transgressive and provocative themes. The premise behind creation of industrial music was to "pursue music in the context of the late industrial society, a dehumanized world increasingly alienated from nature" Def.: Electronic body music EBM or Industrial dance is a music genre that combines elements of industrial music and electronic dance music, characterized by hard and often sparse danceable electronic beats, clear undistorted vocals, shouts or growls with reverberation and echo effects, and repetitive sequencer lines. BitJam warning: Cold, hard and energetic sounds. NO softener included! (Definitions taken from wikipedia)
Mixing by Vincenzo, jingle by CONS logo #98 by Ized

item.title: BitJam Episode #99 - Expect the Unexpected
item.description:
Episode #99 - Expect The Unexpected Expext the unexpected. Anticipate the unthinkable. Gee, even we don't know for sure what to expect from this Podcast. "BitJam - We Ran Out Of Ideas"
Unexpected mixing quality by Vincenzo, expected logo quality #99 by H2O

item.title: BitJam Episode #100 - Milestone - The Flow
item.description:
Episode #100 - Milestone - The Flow Flow theory: "â€¦ flow â€“ the state in which people are so involved in an activity that nothing else seems to matter; the experience itself is so enjoyable that people will do it even at great cost, for the sheer sake of doing it." (Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi, 1991)
100 is a cool number. Not as cool as 128 or 64, of course, but at least it looks like 64 in hex. Anyway. For most things, a 100th episode is a big step - a proof-of-concept, if you will. For us, it means that our podcast has been running for more than two years now on a weekly basis, and that people are still enjoying the noise they make when compiled into hourly blocks. Our hope is to do at least another 100 episodes, and that you all like it as much as you did the previous one - cheers!
Oh, and we have a torrent including episode 51-100, cue files, banners, info, etc, etc...
Mixing by Vincenzo, jingle by CONS, logo #100 by H2O, compiled by The BitFather

item.title: BitJam Episode #101 - Happy 4th BitDay BitFellas!
item.description:
Episode #101 - Happy 4th BitDay BitFellas! Has it really been 4 years? So it seems. Today, the BitFellas forum and all the subprojects it houses, celebrate their fourth birthday! Founded in 2006, there is no denying the impact that BF has had on the scene. From its news service to its scene radio (BitJam), its podcasts (BitJam Podcast), its large collection of articles, interviews and diskmags (SceneCity), its huge Amiga archive (BitWorld) and the newly reopened scene graphics artchive (ArtCity) - BF has become a staple in most sceners everyday online life. So come celebrate our 4th with us - open a beer, and listen to the BitFellas 4th year celebration podcast. Cheers.
Mixing by Vincenzo, logo #101 by KF, thank you for Bobic and Menace for their help!

item.title: BitJam Episode #102 - Journey into Space
item.description:
Episode #102 - Journey into Space BitJam Podcast is finally back! Tonight we'll enter our Bitship and travel from Earth to Universe and back together with you. We'll start our musical journey full of ambient and electronic tunes on our home planet Earth, but soon we'll get high up in the sky to the stars, reaching scene planets until we'll return home later.

The best party of all times must be remembered with great reverence, and thus we at the Hardread Podcast Audio Delivery Service will continue paying tribute to the last Breakpoint with the second half of our musical compiation from the event, this time focusing on the demo and intro soundtracks from the party!

item.description:

item.title: BitJam Episode #112 - Atari 8 bit Music - Classics and Covers
item.description:
Episode #112 - Atari 8 bit Music - Classics & Covers The soundchip of the Atari XL/XE computer wasn't necessarily regarded as its major strength. It got four channels, which made Atarians proud. Yet those four channels were of pretty little sound power. But this makes the classic tunes by Rob Hubbard, David Gilmore and others appear even more impressive. It is an amazing range of sound design, that those pioneers reached in the 80s already. But this was not the end of the story of the Atari 8-bit music. During the more recent years a lot of development has been made to reach a sound quality incomparable to what one would expect from the poor old Pokey - both from a composing and technically view: great compositions and covers, 8 channels stereo, filtering and more. Get an insight into the realm of Pokey with this compilation of Classics & Covers.
Mixing, compiling and jingle by 505, logo #112 by KF

item.title: BitJam Episode #119 - Holy Moly
item.description:

item.title: BitJam Episode #134 - Best of Ubiktune
item.description:
Episode #134 - Best of Ubiktune Ubiktune is chiptune and video game music related netlabel, maintained by C-jeff and Megus. We started in 2006 focusing on music made on ZX Spectrum computer, but the borders were expanded with time. Our current direction is based on progressive, jazz, fusion and funk genres elements. All the tracks for this episode were chosen by our dear fans and listeners during the poll. In case you want to join us, feel free to visit: http://ubiktune.org, or follow with http://facebook.com/ubiktune or http://twitter.com/ubiktune

item.title: BitJam Episode #135 - Revision vs Gathering 2011
item.description:

item.title: BitJam Episode #136 - The Immortal Podcast
item.description:
Episode #136 - The Immortal Podcast Immortal 4 enriches the world of computer game music, featuring remixes of the music from 35 Amiga games in newly arranged studio productions (German Report at .deMOSZENE). BitFellas pays tribute to the fantastic Immortal project and presents a selection of fine music from the Immortal CDs in BitJam Podcast #136, including a previously unreleased track.
The acclaimed â€œImmortalâ€ project started to take shape in the mind of Portuguese game music composer Ruben Monteiro in 1997. The idea behind this project was (and still is) to release the greatest soundtracks from games released for the Commodore Amiga computer on CD - newly arranged and recorded in the studio, but not necessarily in a chart-compatible way. Instead, the â€œImmortalâ€ producers aim to work with the original artists whenever possible: Chris HÃ¼lsbeck, Allister Brimble, Bjorn Lynne, Barry Leitch, Jason Page, Tim Wright and many others contributed exclusive tracks in the past. As of April 2011, four volumes have been released in the â€œImmortalâ€ series, featuring music from classic games such as Shadow of the Beast, Turrican, Speedball 2, Pinball Dreams, Wing Commander, Alien Breed, Lemmings, or Cannon Fodder.
Mixing by Vincenzo, logo #136 by KF & Immortal 4 artists, compiled by Bobic

item.title: BitJam Episode #146 - Orchestral
item.description:
Episode #146 - Orchestral Hello podcast peeps, today we bring you a mix of a slightly less common genre of music to come out of our beloved demoscene; orchestral music. It has to be said though; when they do it, they do it very well and this mix is no exception - featuring the wonderful work of artists as diverse as Lizardking, Moby, Firestorm, Skaven, Blaizer and a whole lot more this is a real joy to listen to and it should be noted that this mix is the first of many orchestral ones we have in the works. So kick back, have a nice cup of tea and enjoy this mix of orchestral styling's from some of the best talents in demoscene audio!
Mixing by Vincenzo, logo #146 by H2O, compiled by Bobic, big thank you to ne7 for his help.

item.title: BitJam Episode #147 - Last Ninja
item.description:
Episode #147 - Last Ninja We have something exceedingly special for you in this podcast; a selection of the very best remixes of the wonderful music created by the total legends that are Ben Daglish, Anthony Lees, Matt Gray & Reyn Ouwehand for the Last Ninja series on the Commodore 64. I'm sure you many of you have fond memories of these classic titles (was it only me that found Last Ninja 2 so bloody hard hehe) and the wonderful music that accompanied them and if not, for gawds sake go and PLAY them! So don your ninja kegs, pull on your slippers, pick up your Ninjato and head down the park with this on your mp3 player and go do some serious Ninja'ing: I know I will!
Mixing by Vincenzo, logo #147 by Grass, big thank you to ne7 and Pohar for their help.

item.title: BitJam Episode #148 - Moby Special
item.description:
Episode #148 - Moby Special It's Sunday, the 29th! It's "Moby day" at BitFellas! Moby... Do we really have to explain who he is? In short: demoscene legend, famous videogame composer, true lover of hard guitar sounds. He recently published his second own album called Hijack with his band Plug-In, which delivers such an incredibly powerful and pleasant blast to the eardrums coupled with fine melodies that we just had to do an interview with him! We chatted with him not only about Hijack and video game music, but also asked him about his start in the demoscene, as well as chatted to him about some very special song experiments.
That's not all for today, because we've prepared a nice podcast episode, a special "Moby special", for you, featuring some of the finest tracks, old and new, from Moby's demoscene history. BitFellas - Let the bass rock!
Mixing by Vincenzo, logo #148 by KF, compiled by Bobic, big thank you to ne7 for his help.

item.title: BitJam Episode #151 - Turrican Special
item.description:
Episode #151 - Turrican Special The classic "Turrican" games brought nonstop action to all gaming systems of the 80's and 90's (including the C64, Amiga, Atari ST and PC, as well as the Sega Genesis and Super Nintendo). The beautiful synthesizer soundtracks for the series were created by Chris Huelsbeck, arguably one of today's most popular game music composers in the world. His music certainly played a major role in shaping "Turrican" into a digital legend over the years. Chris has recently announced plans to bring the cosmic warrior back from retirement, with the production of a "Soundtrack Anthology" - an epic limited edition box set of no less than four CDs, which will feature almost every melody from the saga in newly arranged and recorded versions! More information on this box set, which will only be available until June 3rd, 2012, can be found at www.turricansoundtrack.com.
Almost two decades after the last "Turrican" title was released, BitJam pays tribute to these games and their wonderful music with a dedicated podcast episode. Featured tracks include remixes by Chris himself, as well as a selection of fan arrangements, handpicked by Huelsbeck and the co-producers of his "Turrican Soundtrack Anthology".
Mixing by Vincenzo, logo #151 by H2O, compiled by Chris Huelsbeck, Jan Zottmann & Thomas BÃ¶cker. Thank you to Bobic for his help!

Since the very beginning, I'm a big fan of Jeroen's work and it was a matter of time, to do a complete remix of his music. It was a pleasure for me to present this episode "live on stage" at the Retro-BÃ¶rse in Oberhausen, Germany.
Main music was composed by Jeroen Tel & Reyn Ouwehand, mixing-remixing was dun by Frank "Xenox" Neumann, logo #152 by H2O
